article.headline: Pepperdine 67, Loyola Marymnt 65
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Glen McGowan's slam dunk with 2.7 seconds left in the game gave Pepperdine a 67-65 victory over Loyola Marymount Saturday night. Terrance Johnson scored 20 points while Alex Acker and Yakhouba Diawara had 13 apiece as Pepperdine won its fourth-straight game. McGowan scored 11. Keith Kincade had 21 points and nine rebounds for Loyola Marymount. Pepperdine (13-14, 8-4 West Coast Conference) looked to have sealed the game with a 64-59 lead with 31 seconds remaining. But Matt Knight's layup and Wes Wardrop's two free throws pulled Loyola Marymount (13-12, 4-8) within one, 65-64. The Waves then turned over the ball, setting up two free throws from Kincade to tie the game at 65-65 with 8.9 seconds left. Pepperdine's Shaun Davis dribbled down the court and passed to McGowan who made the game-winning shot. The Waves got their first lead when Yakhouba Diawara scored 20 seconds into the second half to begin the first of two 13-0 runs for Pepperdine in the half. In the first half, Loyola Marymount had two 10-point leads, but Pepperdine closed the half within one at 34-33.
